channel.title: Run time error
channel.description:
[Runtime Error] : Exception: Access violation at address 006543CE in module 'scar.exe'. Read of address 00000008 in line 104 in script C:\Program Files\SCAR 2.03\includes\srl\srl\core\GameTab.scar
i seem to get many runtime errors now wat can i do
i havent been able to use almost any script because of it

item.title: Run time error
item.dc:creator: @yohojo yohojo
item.description:
@yohojo wrote:

Did you rad my post whatsoever?
just make it click the gamtab urself instaead of using Gametab procedure cuz its jacking up

Mouse(x,y,4,4,true)
now get the cordiantes of the gametab you want and replace x and y with them

Read full topic

item.title: Run time error
item.dc:creator: @shadow_clon3 shadow clon3
item.description:
@shadow_clon3 wrote:

Cheesehunk:

Did you set the cross hairs right before you used the script? Set them twice to make sure it has a good handle on the screen. You must set the cross-hairs right before you run the script, because Jagex has made it so the client will lose focus.

i set the cross hairs so many times, but it gives me another runtime error

Read full topic

item.title: Run time error
item.dc:creator: @yohojo yohojo
item.description:
@yohojo wrote:

that happnes to me somtimes for no good reaon.
try running script a few more times.
if that doesnt work just make it click the gametab urself with
Mouse(Gametab,cords,2,2,true)

just like gametab =)

Read full topic

item.title: Run time error
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

Did you set the cross hairs right before you used the script? Set them twice to make sure it has a good handle on the screen. You must set the cross-hairs right before you run the script, because Jagex has made it so the client will lose focus.

Read full topic
